intro: Quercus robur var. cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sessile oak, is a variant of the common oak characterized by its elongated, cuneiform leaves. It is native to central and eastern Europe, thriving in temperate climates with well-drained soils. The tree typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters, featuring a broad, spreading crown and a sturdy trunk. Its leaves are dark green on top and lighter underneath, turning yellow or reddish in autumn. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting diverse wildlife.
